summary_points: 1. Yum! Brands intends to refinance its Series 2016-1 Class A-2-III Notes (approximately $938 million as of June 30, 2025) with $1 billion in new senior term notes, using the net proceeds for repayment of the existing notes, expenses, and general corporate purposes.
2.  As of June 30, 2025, Yum! Brands had approximately $3.7 billion outstanding in various notes issued under its securitization financing facility.
3. There is no assurance that the refinancing transaction will be completed, or what the interest rate will be.
1. Campbell Soup's full-year 2025 adjusted EPS decreased 4% year-over-year to $2.97, with $0.02 of this decline attributed to tariffs.
2.  The company projects a 12% to 18% decline in full-year fiscal 2026 adjusted EPS, with approximately two-thirds of this decline expected to be due to tariffs.
3.  Campbell's Q4 2025 net sales increased by 1% to $2.3 billion, but decreased 3% on an organic basis due to lower volume/mix.

1. Aon plc agreed to sell a majority of its subsidiary NFP Corp.'s wealth businesses to Madison Dearborn Partners for an estimated $2.7 billion, expecting to receive approximately $2.2 billion in after-tax cash proceeds by late Q4 2025.
2. The divested wealth businesses generated $127 million in EBITDA for the twelve months ending June 30, 2025.
3. The sale is predicted to close in late Q4 2025, pending regulatory approvals; its impact on Aon's full-year 2025 results is expected to be immaterial.

1. On August 28, 2025, Evergy, Inc. appointed Charles Caisley to the expanded role of Executive Vice President, Utility Operations and Chief Customer Officer, effective October 1, 2025, resulting in a $700,000 restricted stock unit grant vesting October 7, 2028.
2. This 8-K filing pertains to three Evergy entities: Evergy, Inc., Evergy Kansas Central, Inc., and Evergy Metro, Inc.
3.  The filing is related to a change in officer positions and compensation, not a change in financial performance or legal matters.
1. As of August 2, 2025, Dollar Tree, Inc. had 203,967,842 common shares outstanding.
2. The company's fiscal year focus is 2025, and the filing covers the second quarter (Q2).
3. Dollar Tree, Inc. is categorized as a Large Accelerated Filer and is not considered a small business, an emerging growth company, or a shell company.
1. Dollar Tree sold Family Dollar for approximately $1.225 billion ($800 million net proceeds plus $425 million in anticipated tax benefits) on July 5, 2025.
2. Dollar Tree's Q2 2025 same-store net sales increased 6.5% year-over-year.
3.  Dollar Tree projects full-year fiscal 2025 net sales between $19.3 and $19.5 billion, and adjusted diluted EPS from continuing operations between $5.32 and $5.72.
1. Corning Incorporated's CFO, Edward A. Schlesinger, will give a business update at the Citi 2025 Global TMT Conference on September 4, 2025.
2.  This 8-K filing, submitted on September 3, 2025, reports on events occurring on September 2, 2025.
3. A live audio webcast and replay/transcript (available for 12 months) of the presentation will be accessible on investor.corning.com.
1. On September 2nd, 2025, Wynn Macau, Limited (WML), a subsidiary of Wynn Resorts, Limited, redeemed all outstanding $1 billion of its 5.50% Senior Notes due 2026.
2. Wynn Resorts, Limited owns approximately 72% of WML’s ordinary shares.
3. The delisting of the 2026 Notes from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange is expected to be effective by the close of business on September 11th, 2025.

1. DuPont announced the commencement of exchange offers for three series of its outstanding senior notes in connection with the planned separation of its electronics business into Qnity Electronics, Inc., targeted for completion by November 1, 2025.

2. If the electronics business separation is completed by March 31, 2026, DuPont will redeem a total of $2,160,000,000 principal amount of new notes at a redemption price determined by a formula involving the Treasury Rate plus a spread.

3.  The exchange offers are not subject to a financing condition, but completion of each offer requires at least 50.1% of the outstanding principal amount of the applicable series of existing notes to be validly tendered.

1. DuPont announced the commencement of exchange offers for three series of outstanding notes and is soliciting consents to amend the governing indenture to eliminate substantially all restrictive covenants, as of September 2, 2025.

2.  As of June 30, 2025, DuPont had incurred approximately $645 million in Qualified Spend related to PFAS liabilities, with an additional $217 million in probable and reasonably estimable future Qualified Spend, and a recognized liability of $177 million related to the New Jersey Settlement.

3. DuPont anticipates completing the sale of its aramids business (Kevlar® and Nomex®) during the first quarter of 2026, for a total transaction value of approximately $1.8 billion, receiving approximately $1.2 billion in cash proceeds, a $300 million note receivable, and a non-controlling equity interest valued at $325 million.
